docs.snippet: American exporters, alarmed recently by the rapid inroads being made by Japan in Latin-American markets, win be relieved to know that South American countries share these fears and are moving to curb Japan, Dr. W.E. Weiss, president of Sterling...
docs.lead_paragraph: American exporters, alarmed recently by the rapid inroads being made by Japan in Latin-American markets, win be relieved to know that South American countries share these fears and are moving to curb Japan, Dr. W.E. Weiss, president of Sterling Products Company, Inc., and chairman of the executive committee of the Drug Institute of America, Inc., said yesterday.
docs.abstract: Dr W E Weiss on action in South Amer to curb trade

headline.main: FEARS OVER JAPAN IN LATIN AMERICA; Dr. Weiss, After Tour in South, Says Countries There Move to Curb Her. RESTRICTIONS PLANNED Traditional Trade Relations Are Preferred -- Outlook for U.S. Never Better, He Adds.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, June 30. -- An analysis of the foreign trade of the United States for May, by countries, made public by the Department of Commerce today, showed a slight decline as compared with April in exports to all grand divisions except Northern...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, June 30. -- An analysis of the foreign trade of the United States for May, by countries, made public by the Department of Commerce today, showed a slight decline as compared with April in exports to all grand divisions except Northern North America.

headline.main: MAY EXPORTS FELL AND IMPORTS ROSE; Sales Abroad Were $160,207,044 as Compared With $179,436,743 in April. PURCHASES UP $5,728,568 Gains of $45,993,809 and $39,996,862 Over 1933 Month Are Recorded.

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: The international character of the student population at Columbia University since 1910 is revealed in a survey reported yesterday by Dr. Frank D. Fackenthal, secretary of the university. Ninety-five foreign countries are represented and during the...
docs.lead_paragraph: The international character of the student population at Columbia University since 1910 is revealed in a survey reported yesterday by Dr. Frank D. Fackenthal, secretary of the university. Ninety-five foreign countries are represented and during the period 346,427 men and women, of whom 9,425 came from other lands, have studied at Columbia.

headline.main: 95 LANDS SENT STUDENTS HERE; Columbia Survey of Its Rolls Since 1910 Shows 9,425 Were From Abroad. CANADA AND ORIENT LEAD Cuba, Germany and Britain Also Well Represented in Roster of 346,427 for Period.

docs.snippet: The dollar moved about irregularly last week, measured by the quotation for the French franc. The start on Monday showed a slight gain over the previous week-end at a premium of 0.6 cent, but by Thursday it had declined to 0.4. A closing rally...
docs.lead_paragraph: The dollar moved about irregularly last week, measured by the quotation for the French franc. The start on Monday showed a slight gain over the previous week-end at a premium of 0.6 cent, but by Thursday it had declined to 0.4. A closing rally brought it back to 0.5, unchanged on the week. Business was small and chiefly of a routine character. Range a year ago was 80.66 76.30 cents.

headline.main: FOREIGN EXCHANGE RATES; WEEK ENDED JUNE 30, 1934.

docs.snippet: HENLEY - ON - THAMES, England, July 3. -- The great annual four-day Royal Henley rowing regatta, opening tomorrow, is expected to be one of the most exciting ever held on the historic Thames course, with a record number of American entries.
docs.lead_paragraph: HENLEY - ON - THAMES, England, July 3. -- The great annual four-day Royal Henley rowing regatta, opening tomorrow, is expected to be one of the most exciting ever held on the historic Thames course, with a record number of American entries.

headline.main: RECORD U.S. ENTRY IN HENLEY REGATTA; Two Yale Crews, Kent School and Tabor Academy to Row in Opening Races Today. RUTHERFURD FACES TEST Acting Princeton Coach Meets Douglas in Diamond Sculls -- Tigers Draw Bye.

byline.original: By THURSTON MACAULEY.Wireless to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: Cabinet approves expropriation of butcher shops, Montevideo
docs.abstract: Cabinet approves expropriation of butcher shops, Montevideo

headline.main: Uruguay to Expropriate Butcher Shops in Capital

byline.original: Special Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: HENLEY-ON-THAMES, England, July 3 (AP). -- The biggest representation of American crews and scullers ever gathered on the green-banked Thames will take to the water tomorrow in the preliminary and first rounds of the classic Henley races. The regatta...
docs.lead_paragraph: HENLEY-ON-THAMES, England, July 3 (AP). -- The biggest representation of American crews and scullers ever gathered on the green-banked Thames will take to the water tomorrow in the preliminary and first rounds of the classic Henley races. The regatta will end on Saturday.

headline.main: DR. GUITERAS DIES; FOE OF YELLOW FEVER; Led 17-Year Fight on Scourge in South -- Joined U. S. Public Health Service in 1888.
